member.name: T:BOOSEInterpreter.Canvas.PanelCanvas
member.summary: An implementation that renders drawing operations onto a control by maintaining an internal and associated instance.
member.remarks: The class provides simple drawing primitives (lines, circles, rectangles, triangles and text) and manages an in-memory bitmap which is assigned to the provided via its property. Methods are not thread-safe and should be called from the UI thread that owns the . The class expects color values to be provided as a stored in the property.

member.name: F:BOOSEInterpreter.Canvas.PanelCanvas.bitmap
member.summary: The backing instance that represents the pixel buffer used for all drawing operations. This bitmap is assigned to the host so that the UI displays the current drawing state.

member.name: F:BOOSEInterpreter.Canvas.PanelCanvas.graphics
member.summary: The object created from . All drawing primitives (lines, shapes, text) are executed through this object. It is recreated whenever the internal bitmap is replaced via .

member.name: P:BOOSEInterpreter.Canvas.PanelCanvas.Xpos
member.summary: The current X coordinate of the logical pen. Several drawing operations (for example , ) use this position as their origin or start point. Coordinates are expressed in pixels relative to the top-left corner of the canvas.

member.name: P:BOOSEInterpreter.Canvas.PanelCanvas.Ypos
member.summary: The current Y coordinate of the logical pen. See for additional details about the coordinate system and usage.

member.name: P:BOOSEInterpreter.Canvas.PanelCanvas.PenColour
member.summary: The colour used for subsequent drawing operations. The property type is for compatibility with the surrounding interpreter infrastructure, but callers should assign and expect a value. The default value is .
member.remarks: When used, callers typically cast this value to . Setting the property to an incompatible type will result in an at the point of drawing.

member.name: F:BOOSEInterpreter.Canvas.PanelCanvas.output
member.summary: The control that is used to present the current to the user. The control's property is updated whenever the bitmap changes.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Canvas.PanelCanvas.#ctor(System.Windows.Forms.PictureBox)
member.summary: Creates a new bound to the supplied .
member.param: The that will display the drawing surface. Must not be null. The caller is responsible for ensuring the control is created on the UI thread.
member.remarks: If already has a non-zero size at construction time, an internal bitmap is created immediately with that size by calling . Otherwise the surface will be created when the UI initializes the control size and an explicit call to is made.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Canvas.PanelCanvas.Set(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allocates a new internal drawing surface with the specified pixel dimensions and resets the rendering context.
member.param: The width of the new bitmap in pixels. Must be greater than zero.
The height of the new bitmap in pixels. Must be greater than zero.
member.remarks: Any existing bitmap/graphics objects are replaced. The new surface is cleared to white and assigned to the bound control. Callers should ensure the provided dimensions match the display control to avoid scaling artifacts.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Canvas.PanelCanvas.MoveTo(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Updates the logical pen position to the provided coordinates without emitting any drawing primitives. Subsequent drawing operations will use this position as their origin or start point.
member.param: The new X coordinate in pixels.
The new Y coordinate in pixels.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Canvas.PanelCanvas.DrawTo(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draws a straight line from the current logical pen position to the specified destination coordinates. After the call the pen position is updated to the target point.
member.param: Destination X coordinate in pixels.
Destination Y coordinate in pixels.
member.remarks: The line is drawn using a pen of width 2 and the colour provided by . The method calls to update the UI after drawing. If cannot be cast to , an exception will be thrown.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Canvas.PanelCanvas.Circle(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Draws a circle (ellipse with equal width and height) centered on the current pen position. The circle may be filled or outlined depending on .
member.param: The radius of the circle in pixels. Must be non-negative.
If true the shape is filled using a solid brush, otherwise only the outline is rendered using a pen.
member.remarks: The drawing operation uses for both outline and fill. Calling code should ensure the radius is reasonable for the current canvas size.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Canvas.PanelCanvas.Rect(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Draws a rectangle whose top-left corner is the current pen position. The rectangle may be filled or outlined depending on .
member.param: The width of the rectangle in pixels.
The height of the rectangle in pixels.
If true the interior is filled; otherwise only the border is drawn.
member.remarks: Width/height values that cause the rectangle to extend outside the bitmap will be clipped by the underlying implementation.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Canvas.PanelCanvas.Tri(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draws an isosceles triangle where the base's left corner is at the current pen position and the triangle extends downwards by pixels.
member.param: The width of the triangle base in pixels.
The vertical height of the triangle in pixels.
member.remarks: The triangle's vertices are calculated so that the apex is centered horizontally above the base. The shape is drawn using the current as the outline colour with a pen width of 2.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Canvas.PanelCanvas.Clear
member.summary: Clears the entire drawing surface by filling it with white and requests a UI refresh so the cleared state becomes visible to the user.
member.remarks: This method only clears the internal and does not change pen position or colour; to reset those values use .

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Canvas.PanelCanvas.Reset
member.summary: Resets the drawing state by setting the logical pen position to (0,0) and the drawing colour to black. Does not clear the bitmap; use to erase existing content.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Canvas.PanelCanvas.SetColour(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the current drawing colour using explicit red, green and blue components.
member.param: Red channel (0-255).
Green channel (0-255).
Blue channel (0-255).
member.remarks: Values outside the 0â€“255 range will be clamped by the method.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Canvas.PanelCanvas.WriteText(System.String)
member.summary: Renders the provided text string at the current pen coordinates using a default sans-serif font. After drawing the method triggers a UI refresh.
member.param: The text to draw. If null the method will throw an when attempting to draw; callers should ensure a valid string is provided.
member.remarks: The method uses an of Arial, size 14 and draws the string using a created from .

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Canvas.PanelCanvas.getBitmap
member.summary: Returns the underlying instance used as the in-memory drawing surface. The method signature returns for compatibility with existing caller expectations in the application code.
member.returns: The currently used as the canvas pixel buffer, or null if has not been called.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Canvas.PanelCanvas.Refresh
member.summary: Assigns the current internal bitmap to the bound property and forces an immediate repaint of the control so that recent drawing operations become visible.
member.remarks: This helper method is private because it manipulates UI elements; it should be invoked from the UI thread. The method performs a direct assignment to the property which may replace any previously set image reference.

member.name: T:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.AppCommandFactory
member.summary: Factory that creates application-specific command implementations for the BOOSE interpreter.
member.remarks: extends the base and returns command implementations that integrate with the application's where drawing or canvas access is required. For language constructs that have unrestricted replacements (e.g. int, real, array, control-flow commands), the factory returns the corresponding App* replacement implementations. If a command name is not recognised the factory falls back to the base implementation by calling .

member.name: F:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.AppCommandFactory.canvas
member.summary: The canvas instance that created commands will use for rendering.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.AppCommandFactory.#ctor(BOOSEInterpreter.Canvas.PanelCanvas)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The that commands should draw to.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.AppCommandFactory.MakeCommand(System.String)
member.summary: Create an instance for the provided command .
member.param: The command name to create (case-insensitive).
member.returns: An instance that implements the requested command. If the command name is not handled by this factory the method delegates to .
member.remarks: The factory maps a set of known command names to their application-specific implementations. Drawing-related commands receive the instance supplied to the factory constructor. Control-flow and replacement commands (such as int, real, array, if, for, while, end, method, call) are provided as unrestricted replacements by returning the corresponding App* types.

member.name: T:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Command.AppCircle
member.summary: Command that draws a circle on the application canvas. The command evaluates a single parameter expression (typically an integer radius) and instructs the provided instance to draw an unfilled circle at the current pen position.
member.remarks: inherits from , which provides the textual and the context used for evaluation. The command uses to convert the parameter expression to an integer radius. The command will throw a if it is not initialised with a valid program or if the parameter is missing or invalid.

member.name: F:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Command.AppCircle._canvas
member.summary: The canvas instance used to render the circle.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Command.AppCircle.#ctor(BOOSEInterpreter.Canvas.PanelCanvas)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified for rendering.
member.param: The canvas that will receive the circle drawing commands. Must not be null.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Command.AppCircle.Execute
member.summary: Executes the circle command. The method: - Validates that the command has been initialised with a . - Reads and trims the textual and ensures a single parameter is present. - Evaluates the expression to an integer radius using . - Calls with the computed radius and false for the filled flag (draw outline only).
member.exception: Thrown when the command has no associated program or when the required parameter is missing/invalid.

member.name: T:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Command.AppDrawTo
member.summary: Command that draws a straight line from the current pen position to the specified coordinates. The command expects two parameters (X and Y) which are evaluated in the current program context and converted to integer pixel coordinates.
member.remarks: inherits from , which provides access to the textual and the execution context. The command uses to evaluate each parameter. A is thrown when the command is not initialised with a program or when parameters are missing or invalid.

member.name: F:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Command.AppDrawTo._canvas
member.summary: The canvas that will be used to render the line.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Command.AppDrawTo.#ctor(BOOSEInterpreter.Canvas.PanelCanvas)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The the command will draw onto. Must not be null.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Command.AppDrawTo.Execute
member.summary: Executes the command by validating and parsing the two required parameters, evaluating them to integer coordinates, and invoking .
member.exception: Thrown when the command lacks a program, when the parameter list is empty, or when the wrong number of parameters is provided.

member.name: T:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Command.AppMoveTo
member.summary: Command that updates the current pen position without drawing. Expects two parameters (X and Y) which are evaluated and converted to integer coordinates.
member.remarks: inherits from , which supplies the textual . Parameter evaluation is delegated to . The command throws a if it is not initialised with a program or if parameters are missing or malformed.

member.name: F:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Command.AppMoveTo._canvas
member.summary: The canvas whose current pen position will be modified.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Command.AppMoveTo.#ctor(BOOSEInterpreter.Canvas.PanelCanvas)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance that operates on the provided canvas.
member.param: The to update. Must not be null.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Command.AppMoveTo.Execute
member.summary: Executes the move operation: validates parameters, evaluates them to integers and calls to set the new pen position.
member.exception: Thrown when the command has no program or when parameters are missing or not exactly two in number.

member.name: T:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Command.AppPenColour
member.summary: Command that sets the pen colour used for subsequent drawing operations. Expects three numeric parameters representing the red, green and blue channels (0-255).
member.remarks: inherits from , which provides the textual data. Parameters are evaluated using and applied to the canvas via . The command will throw a when not initialised with a program or when parameters are missing or incorrectly formed.

member.name: F:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Command.AppPenColour._canvas
member.summary: The target canvas whose pen colour will be modified.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Command.AppPenColour.#ctor(BOOSEInterpreter.Canvas.PanelCanvas)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the command.
member.param: The to update. Must not be null.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Command.AppPenColour.Execute
member.summary: Executes the command by parsing three color components (R, G, B) from the , evaluating them to integers and calling .
member.exception: Thrown when the command has no program, when the parameter list is empty or not exactly three values.

member.name: T:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Command.AppRect
member.summary: Command that draws an unfilled rectangle on the canvas. The command expects two parameters representing the rectangle's width and height in pixels.
member.remarks: inherits from , which provides the and context. Parameters are evaluated using . A is raised if the command is not initialised or if the parameters are missing or invalid.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Command.AppRect.#ctor(BOOSEInterpreter.Canvas.PanelCanvas)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the command.
member.param: The to draw onto. Must not be null.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Command.AppRect.Execute
member.summary: Executes the command by parsing and evaluating the width and height parameters and invoking with the evaluated values and false to indicate an outline-only rectangle.
member.exception: Thrown when the command lacks a program or when parameters are empty or not exactly two values.

member.name: T:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Command.AppTriCommand
member.summary: Command that draws an isosceles triangle on the canvas. The command expects two parameters: the base width and the triangle height, both evaluated as integers.
member.remarks: derives from , which provides access to the textual and the current . Parameter evaluation uses . Errors in initialization or parameter parsing result in a .

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Command.AppTriCommand.#ctor(BOOSEInterpreter.Canvas.PanelCanvas)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The to draw onto. Must not be null.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Command.AppTriCommand.Execute
member.summary: Executes the command by validating, parsing and evaluating the width and height parameters and invoking to draw the triangle.
member.exception: Thrown when the command has no program or when parameters are missing, empty, or not exactly two values.

member.name: T:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Command.AppWrite
member.summary: Application-specific implementation of the command that renders evaluated text to a instance.
member.remarks: evaluates the textual expression contained in in the context of the associated and writes the resulting string to the canvas using . If the expression refers to a boolean variable stored in the program, the command writes "true" or "false" instead of the variable object's textual form.

member.name: F:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Command.AppWrite.canvas
member.summary: The canvas used to render text for this command.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Command.AppWrite.#ctor(BOOSEInterpreter.Canvas.PanelCanvas)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the provided canvas.
member.param: The used to draw the output text. Must not be null.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Command.AppWrite.Execute
member.summary: Executes the write command. The method validates that a is associated with the command, reads the expression from and evaluates it to a string using . If the expression names a boolean variable in the program, the boolean value is printed as "true"/"false". The resulting text is written to the canvas via .
member.exception: Thrown when the command has not been initialised with a .

member.name: T:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppArray
member.summary: Replacement implementation for BOOSE array declarations supporting 1D and 2D arrays of integers or real numbers.
member.remarks:
Parses declarations such as:
array int myArr 10 array real myArr 10,20 array myArr 10,20 (defaults to int)
Allocations occur during . The class exposes methods to set and retrieve cell values with bounds checking and performs type-specific storage in separate backing arrays.

member.name: P:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppArray.ElementType
member.summary: Gets the declared element type for this array (int or real).

member.name: P:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppArray.Rows
member.summary: Gets the number of rows allocated for this array (first dimension).

member.name: P:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppArray.Cols
member.summary: Gets the number of columns allocated for this array (second dimension).

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppArray.Compile
member.summary: Parses the textual declaration in , establishes the element type and dimensions, allocates the underlying storage and registers the variable with the program's variable table.
member.exception: Thrown when the declaration is invalid or when no is associated with this command.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppArray.Execute
member.summary: No runtime action is required for an array declaration; allocation and registration are handled in .

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppArray.SetCell(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Evaluates in the current program context and assigns the resulting value to the specified cell.
member.param: Zero-based row index.
Zero-based column index.
Expression to evaluate for the cell value.
member.exception: Thrown when the command is not associated with a , when indices are out of range, or when the backing store for the declared element type is not allocated.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppArray.GetCell(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the contents of the specified cell as a string. Real values are formatted using invariant culture.
member.param: Zero-based row index.
Zero-based column index.
member.returns: The cell value formatted as a string.
member.exception: Thrown when the command is not associated with a , when indices are invalid, or when the backing store is not allocated.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppArray.ValidateIndex(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Validates that the given indices are within the allocated array bounds and throws a when they are not.
member.param: Zero-based row index.
Zero-based column index.
member.exception: Thrown when either index is out of range.

member.name: T:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppBoolean
member.summary: Unrestricted boolean variable implementation.
member.remarks: Stores a boolean value and integrates with the program's variable table. The declaration may optionally provide an initialiser expression (e.g. "boolean x = true"). The evaluation and storage keep and the base int representation in sync.

member.name: P:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppBoolean.BoolValue
member.summary: The boolean value represented by this variable.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppBoolean.Compile
member.summary: Parses the declaration from , extracting the variable name and optional initialiser expression. Registers the variable with the program if it does not already exist.
member.exception: Thrown when no program is associated or when the declaration is missing a variable name.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppBoolean.Execute
member.summary: Evaluates the boolean expression, updates and the base integer , and stores or updates the variable in the program's variable table.
member.exception: Thrown when the command is not associated with a .

member.name: T:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppCall
member.summary:
Replace implementation of the BOOSE call command.
The BOOSE library's ties into the restricted class. This rewritten version works with and allows multiple methods/calls.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppCall.CheckParameters(System.String[])
member.summary: Validates that at least one parameter (the method name) is provided.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppCall.Compile
member.summary: Parses the parameter list extracting the target method name and the list of argument expressions. Argument evaluation is deferred until .

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppCall.Execute
member.summary: Executes a method call by resolving the target , creating and initialising local parameter variables, ensuring the return variable exists, pushing a call frame and jumping into the method body.
member.exception: Thrown when the command is not attached to a , when the method cannot be found, when the argument count does not match, or when an unsupported parameter type is encountered.

member.name: T:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppElse
member.summary: Replacement implementation for BOOSE else which pairs with an earlier if compound command.
member.remarks: During compilation the corresponding if command is popped from the program stack and its end-line is set so that control flow can locate the else branch. At runtime reaching an else means the if branch executed, so the runtime should skip the else body and continue after the matching end.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppElse.Compile
member.summary: Performs compile-time pairing with the matching if command and registers this else on the program stack so that the matching end pairs correctly.
member.exception: Thrown when not associated with a program or when there is no matching if on the stack.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppElse.Execute
member.summary: At runtime, skip the else body since execution reached else only when the if branch was executed. The program counter is set to the command after the matching end.

member.name: T:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppEnd
member.summary:
Replacement implementation for BOOSE end which closes compound blocks such as:
end if
end while
end for
end method

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppEnd.Compile
member.summary: Performs compile-time validation that the end matches a previously opened compound block and records pairing information for runtime control flow.
member.exception: Thrown when no matching opening block exists or when the types do not match (for example, end for without a preceding for).

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppEnd.Execute
member.summary: Executes the end command by performing the appropriate control-flow action based on the paired opening block. Actions include: returning from methods, looping back for while and for, and cleaning up local variables for methods.

member.name: T:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppFor
member.summary: Replacement implementation for BOOSE for loops supporting common syntax variations such as for i=1 to 10 step 1 and comma-separated forms.
member.remarks: The command lazily evaluates bounds on first execution (allowing dependencies on other variables) and uses an internal Advance helper for iteration logic which is called by the corresponding end for implementation.

member.name: P:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppFor.LcvName
member.summary: The loop control variable name.

member.name: P:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppFor.Current
member.summary: The current integer value of the loop control variable.

member.name: P:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppFor.To
member.summary: The evaluated loop upper bound.

member.name: P:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppFor.Step
member.summary: The evaluated step increment used when advancing the loop.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppFor.Compile
member.summary: Parses the for loop signature and pushes this command onto the program stack so that the matching end for can pair with it.
member.exception: Thrown when not associated with a program or when the signature is missing/invalid.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppFor.Execute
member.summary: Evaluates loop bounds and initialises or updates the loop control variable. If the loop condition is not met, the program counter is advanced to the command after the matching end for.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppFor.Advance(BOOSE.StoredProgram)
member.summary: Advances the loop by one step. This method is intended to be called by the end for implementation and updates the loop control variable accordingly.
member.param: The program instance used to add/update the loop control variable.
member.returns: true if the loop should continue after the advance; otherwise false.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppFor.ParseSignature(System.String)
member.summary: Parses the for-loop signature which may be in comma-separated form (i,1,10,1) or in keyword form (i=1 to 10 step 1).
member.param: The raw signature text from the command.
member.exception: Thrown when the signature is empty or invalid.

member.name: T:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppIf
member.summary: Replacement implementation for BOOSE if that evaluates a conditional expression and controls flow into the true or false branch.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppIf.Compile
member.summary: Compiles the if command by recording its line number, storing the conditional expression from , setting the command type and pushing the command to the program stack for later pairing with an else or end.
member.exception: Thrown when the command is not associated with a program.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppIf.Execute
member.summary: Evaluates the condition at runtime and, if the condition is false, advances the program counter to the first command of the false branch (either after the else line or after the matching end when no else exists).

member.name: T:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppInt
member.summary: Unrestricted integer variable command used to declare and manage integer variables within a .
member.remarks: Supports declaring multiple variables in a single statement (comma-separated) and optional initialisers. Initialiser expressions are not evaluated at compile time to allow method parameter dependencies; evaluation occurs during .

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppInt.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor for an uninitialised integer variable declaration.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppInt.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an with the specified name and initial integer value.
member.param: Variable name.
Initial integer value.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppInt.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates an with the specified name and an initialiser expression provided as text (parsed with ).
member.param: Variable name.
Initial value text.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppInt.Compile
member.summary: Parses the declaration(s) from , records the primary variable and any additional comma-separated declarations and registers the variable with the program if necessary.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppInt.Execute
member.summary: Ensures any extra variables declared alongside the primary variable exist, evaluates the initializer expression and stores the resulting integer value in the program's variable table.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppInt.ParseAndDeclare(System.String)
member.summary: Parses the textual declaration which may either be a single assignment (name=expr) or a comma-separated list of names. Populates the primary variable, optional expression and any extra declarations.
member.param: Declaration text.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppInt.ParseToInt(System.String)
member.summary: Parses a textual value into an integer. Floating values are rounded to the nearest integer and non-numeric input yields zero.
member.param: The input text to parse.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppInt.NormaliseName(System.String)
member.summary: Normalises a variable declaration token by returning the last whitespace-separated token (allowing forms such as "int x").
member.param: Raw token text.
member.returns: Normalised variable name or empty string if input invalid.

member.name: T:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppMethod
member.summary:
Unrestricted implementation of the BOOSE method declaration.
The BOOSE library's class enforces restrictions (e.g., only a single method). This class rewrites the behaviour so that multiple methods are allowed.
Syntax example:
method int mulMethod int one, int two mulMethod = one * two end method

member.name: P:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppMethod.ReturnType
member.summary: Gets the return type as declared (e.g. int, real).

member.name: P:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppMethod.MethodName
member.summary: Gets the method name.

member.name: P:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppMethod.MethodParameters
member.summary: Gets the ordered list of method parameters.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppMethod.CheckParameters(System.String[])
member.summary: BOOSE base method does not validate beyond compile-time parsing. This override intentionally performs no additional checks.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppMethod.Compile
member.summary: Parses the method signature (return type, name and parameters) and registers the declaration in the program so that call can locate it.
member.exception: Thrown when the declaration is missing or malformed, or when no program is associated with this command.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppMethod.Execute
member.summary: Registers the method declaration in the runtime and skips execution of the method body at top-level program execution. The method body is entered only when a corresponding call command is executed.

member.name: T:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppPeek
member.summary: Unrestricted replacement for BOOSE peek which reads a value from an array into a program variable.
member.remarks: The command accepts several syntaxes such as y = prices 5 or y,prices,5. Numeric conversions are handled to create or update the target variable with the appropriate numeric type (int or real) based on the array element type.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppPeek.CheckParameters(System.String[])
member.summary: Lightweight parameter validation; detailed parsing is performed in .

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppPeek.Compile
member.summary: Parses and validates the parameter list for the peek command.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppPeek.Execute
member.summary: Executes the peek operation by reading a value from the named array at the evaluated indices and creating or updating the target variable in the program.
member.exception: Thrown when not attached to a program or when the named array does not exist or is not an array.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppPeek.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parses the textual parameter list supporting forms with '=' or comma/space separated tokens and extracts the target variable, array name and index expressions.
member.param: Raw parameter text from the command.

member.name: T:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppPoke
member.summary: Unrestricted replacement for BOOSE poke which writes a value into an array element by evaluating a supplied expression.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppPoke.CheckParameters(System.String[])
member.summary: Minimal parameter validation; full parsing and validation occur in .

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppPoke.Compile
member.summary: Parses the parameter list to determine the target array, indices and value expression.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppPoke.Execute
member.summary: Executes the poke operation by evaluating the row/column expressions and delegating to which handles type-specific storage.
member.exception: Thrown when the command is not associated with a program or when the named array is not found.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppPoke.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parses the textual parameters supporting forms like prices 5 = 99.99, prices,5,99.99 or arr 2 3 = 99 and extracts the array name, row/col expressions and the value expression.
member.param: Raw parameter text.

member.name: T:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppReal
member.summary:
Unrestricted real-number variable command.
Note: BOOSE's built-in is sealed. This class aims to be API-compatible enough for the coursework, while remaining simple.

member.name: P:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppReal.Value
member.summary: Real value (hides which is an int).

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppReal.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppReal.#ctor(System.String,System.Double)
member.summary: Constructs an with a name and initial double value.
member.param: Variable name.
Initial real value.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppReal.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructs an with a textual initialiser parsed to a double.
member.param: Variable name.
Textual initial value to parse.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppReal.Compile
member.summary: Parses the declaration and registers the variable with the program if necessary.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppReal.Execute
member.summary: Evaluates the initialiser expression (if any), updates the stored real value and ensures the variable exists in the program's variable table.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppReal.ParseAndDeclare(System.String)
member.summary: Parses the textual declaration which may either be a single assignment (name=expr) or a comma-separated list of names. Populates the primary variable, optional expression and any extra declarations.
member.param: Declaration text.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppReal.ParseToDouble(System.String)
member.summary: Parses textual input to a double. Integer tokens are returned as their numeric value and non-numeric input returns 0.0.
member.param: Textual input.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppReal.NormaliseName(System.String)
member.summary: Normalises a variable declaration token by returning the last whitespace-separated token (allowing forms such as "real x").
member.param: Raw token text.
member.returns: Normalised variable name or empty string if input invalid.

member.name: T:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppWhile
member.summary: Represents an unrestricted BOOSE while loop command.
member.remarks: During compilation, this command records the loop's start line and pushes itself onto the program's compound stack so it can later be matched with a corresponding End command. At runtime, evaluates the loop condition and advances the program counter to exit the loop when the condition is false. The loop condition expression is taken from and stored in during .

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppWhile.Compile
member.summary: Compiles the while command by capturing the current line number, storing the conditional expression, and pushing this command onto the program compound stack.
member.remarks: This enables a matching End command (e.g., end-while) to resolve the loop boundaries and set .
member.exception: Thrown when has not been assigned.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppWhile.Execute
member.summary: Executes the while command by evaluating the stored conditional expression.
member.remarks: Uses to evaluate in the current program context. If the expression evaluates to false, execution skips the loop body by setting to + 1. If the expression evaluates to true, execution continues into the loop body.
member.exception: Thrown when has not been assigned.

member.name: T:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.MethodRegistry
member.summary: Registry that stores method declarations for unrestricted BOOSE programs.
member.remarks: The original BOOSE Method/Call support is limited. This registry allows the interpreter to register, retrieve and replace multiple declarations by name. It uses case-insensitive keys and exposes a singleton for global access during program compilation and execution.

member.name: P:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.MethodRegistry.Instance
member.summary: Singleton instance used by the runtime and compiler to access registered methods.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.MethodRegistry.Clear
member.summary: Remove all registered methods from the registry.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.MethodRegistry.Register(BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.AppMethod)
member.summary: Register a method declaration. If a method with the same name already exists it is replaced.
member.param: The to register.
member.exception: If is null.
If the method has an empty or whitespace name.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.MethodRegistry.Get(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve a registered method by name.
member.param: The name of the method to retrieve.
member.exception: If is null/whitespace or the method is not found.

member.name: T:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.MethodRuntime
member.summary: Runtime helper that manages active method call frames for BOOSE programs.
member.remarks: Method calls are represented by a that stores the return program counter and the list of local variables created for the call. The runtime maintains a stack of frames; callers push a frame before jumping into the method body and pop the frame when the method returns.

member.name: P:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.MethodRuntime.HasFrame
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether there is at least one active method frame.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.MethodRuntime.Clear
member.summary: Clear all active call frames. This should be called when a new program run starts to ensure no stale frames from a previous (failed) execution remain.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.MethodRuntime.Push(BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.MethodFrame)
member.summary: Push a new onto the call stack.
member.param: The frame representing the active method call.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.MethodRuntime.Pop
member.summary: Pop the top from the call stack.
member.exception: If the call stack is empty.

member.name: T:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.MethodFrame
member.summary: Represents an active method call frame.
member.remarks: A frame stores the method name (for diagnostics), the return program counter and the list of local variable names that need to be cleaned up when the method returns.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.MethodFrame.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.String})
member.summary: Create a new method frame.
member.param: The method's name.
The program counter to return to after the call.
The list of local variable names introduced by the method.

member.name: P:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.MethodFrame.MethodName
member.summary: The name of the method.

member.name: P:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.MethodFrame.ReturnPc
member.summary: The program counter to return to after the method completes.

member.name: P:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Replace.MethodFrame.Locals
member.summary: The names of the local variables declared by the method.

The expression to evaluate. May be a numeric literal, variable name or arithmetic expression.
member.returns: The expression value converted to an (rounded from when necessary).

member.summary: Evaluate an expression and coerce it to a .
member.param: The current used to resolve variables.
The expression to evaluate. May include numeric literals, variables and arithmetic operators.
member.exception: If is null.

member.summary: Lightweight recursive-descent parser for arithmetic expressions producing values.

member.summary: Parse a term (handles multiplication and division).

member.summary: Parse a factor: unary +/- operators, parenthesised expressions, numeric literals or identifiers.

member.summary: Read a C-style identifier from the current parse position (letters, digits and underscore, starting with letter or underscore).
member.returns: The identifier text or an empty string if none found.

member.summary: Advance the parser position past any whitespace.

member.summary: Attempt to match the next character; advance on success.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Core.Runtime.BooseEval.SimpleDoubleParser.Remaining
member.summary: Return the remaining unparsed text (trimmed) for error messages.

member.summary: Evaluate an expression and coerce it to a .

The boolean expression to evaluate. May include comparisons and logical operators.

member.summary: Stores ALL executed commands (history) used when saving code.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Form1.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Sets up all required BOOSE components and UI bindings.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Form1.Log(System.String)
member.summary: Appends a message to the debug console area.
member.param: Message to output.

member.name: M:BOOSEInterpreter.Form1.ResetBooseStaticRestrictionCounters
member.summary:
BOOSE.dll implements coursework restrictions using static counters inside several BOOSE classes (e.g., BOOSE.Boolean/Int/Real). Those counters persist for the lifetime of the application process, so running multiple example programs without closing the app can incorrectly accumulate counts and trigger "Variable limit reached" errors.
We reset those counters on each run so each program starts from a clean restriction state. This mirrors what happens naturally when you close and reopen the application.
